content.title: How WhatsApp Handles Millions of Group Calls

slides.headline: The Challenge
slides.content: WhatsApp processes 2+ billion minutes of group calls daily. How do they maintain quality at this scale?
slides.visual_description: Split screen showing WhatsApp logo and network diagram with multiple users

slides.headline: SFU vs MCU
slides.content: Selective Forwarding Unit (SFU) vs Multipoint Control Unit (MCU). SFU is more scalable but complex.
slides.visual_description: Architecture diagram comparing SFU and MCU approaches

slides.headline: Smart Signaling
slides.content: WhatsApp uses WebRTC signaling with custom optimizations for mobile networks and battery life.
slides.visual_description: Mobile phone with network signals and battery optimization indicators

slides.headline: Backpressure Magic
slides.content: Intelligent backpressure prevents network congestion by dynamically adjusting quality based on conditions.
slides.visual_description: Network traffic flow diagram with adaptive quality controls

slides.headline: The Result
slides.content: Sub-200ms latency with 99.9% uptime across 180+ countries. That's engineering excellence!
slides.visual_description: Global map showing WhatsApp coverage with performance metrics
